post.body: I think small & efficient and HF is tautology. I tried monoband mobile whips in Brum - OK for strong stns but need groundplane.
Tried http://keepvid.com ?
Still long process. It's a project for Christmas mainly :)
Pleased you have it at last! I suggest not ordering an ant from the same people, or you risk not making IARU.
Thanks. The website is the official IOTA site: rsgbiota.org.
No, differentiating and praising the very best whilst acknowledging the nice things :)
I've not re-read Lord of the Flies since it was one of my GCSE English set texts
Interesting: top global queries are mostly concepts whereas UK's top 7 are domains. Do some people use Google as address bar?
Thanks for the link. Do you know what database runs the lookups?
#iplayerday Good to hear Anthony Rose talk abt supporting more devices. I'm looking forward to iPlayer on Freesat STBs in future.
Good luck, Pete
OK but irony, esp. self-directed, normally requires intonation so doesn't tend to work in tweets! So you were being esp. confusing
Sounds like you are confusing Lord of the Flies and Lord of the Rings in your reply to @NornIronMan
Mum and Dad say many thanks
Rather disturbed by last night's 'I'd die for a cassock' tweet. Is this a perversion?
A hotel on the Causeway? Hope u have flooding insurance!
Found it now!
The St. Kilda programme is on iPlayer: http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b00gbgx0
In bham uni for supervision
Off to Birmingham today.
MSWord, Pse print even pages 184-204, using page nos that restart in s2. That's 191-211 in the doc. OK? Not random pages with any number.
Still very short of words on my thesis. Oh dear :(
Thesis work
Just sent a long email about IOTA to the ADIF developers list #HAMR
Watching the State Opening of Parliament.
Finishing some bits and pieces before my supervision in Birmingham tomorrow.
Just been watching Prof. Brian Cox on BBC2 explaining space-time. As excellent as ever.
Just saw Testcard X on the new BBC HD Preview loop. :D
Up late. Going to be spending the day formatting my thesis and playing with EndNote. Joy.
New Video: M0BLF CQ WW DX CW 2008 http://tinyurl.com/5kx9od
News: M0BLF in CQ WW DX CW Contest http://tinyurl.com/5l9jyg
Loving the new design of BBCPersian.com - Anyone else notice how the blue/red news logo looks like BBC Alba's An Là?
BBC Parliament showing breakdown slide instead of Banking Crisis Committee. Are things that bad?
Congrats to the guys at CU Spaceflight. http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/sci/tech/7767376.stm Now you can work on your ham licenses.
Building crystal sets with the Scouts tonight.
Ignoring the can of worms I seem to have opened on the ADIF dev list until the weekend, and trying to concentrate on my thesis instead.
Back home in Devon. Quick dinner then radio club.
On train back to Plymouth. Supervision OK but lots still to do.
Got my ratebeer.com tasting notes mainly up-to-date: http://tinyurl.com/6hjqro
Updating my records on ratebeer.com
Retweeting @rmc47: Oh dear... Wikipedia and the IWF have fallen out... http://tinyurl.com/6zz2nk
Morning all. Dry & crisp morning. Not freezing here though.
Thesis bibliography work zzz
Watching Sppoks. Excellent but don't think they'll have found a numbers station on 102 MHz NFM!
Managed to book parents' holiday for them. Got no work done but lots of brownie points.
Off to the dentist for a checkup
The BBC is accused of discrimination by the Venezuelan Ambassador for only asking for opinions of Chávez in English: http://snurl.com/7nalb
Was hoping to do better but scored 12/15 :S Oh well, I passed the real thing when I was 11 at least. http://snurl.com/7qvx7
Heading into Plymouth for Christmas shopping.
Just found a photocopy I made from a German-language book on metaphysics. I must have thought it useful at some stage but can't see why.
Morning twitterverse. Listening to cricket and getting ready to go into Tavistock.
Changes to QRZ.com have broken callsign lookups on rsgbiota.org. We're currently providing cached info only. Fix soon unlikely. Sorry. #HAMR
Going to a church carol-singing rehersal, then to the radio club Christmas dinner.
Bus lane outside Tesco, Roborough, Plymouth has 'Crunchy Nut Lane' painted on it :)
Listening to cricket vs. India. Eng not doing badly for once.
At Google UK for a meeting.
Heading 'up the line' to London
Going to London tomorrow
Just noticed that The Box (www.bbc.co.uk/thebox) now bears a .com URL not .co.uk. Has it had a repaint in the US or are there actually two?
Thesis-ing
Watching a prog about the closure of small post offices in the Highlands&Islands on iPlayer. "People can get stamps in Woolworths". Oh dear.
Reading articles about Google OpenEdge and failing to see what it has to do with net neutrality.
Been listening to a rollercoaster first test against India.
Cooking dinner for Mum and Dad
Parents' ruby wedding anniv. All family going to Church together.
Brother is home from London for the weekend, so all the family is going for a Chinese :)
Just back from pub quiz. Did OK but didn't win anything.
Going carol singing in Meavy L:50.487,-4.058:
Replying to QSL Cards. Joy. #HAMR
Can I point out that an RSS feed with an HTTP Expires header set 6 hours in the future does not mean 'refetch this every 8 seconds'! Grrr..
Very windy walk on Pew Tor, Dartmoor. L:50.5426,-4.0728:
Walked off a nice pasty and pint of Tinner's ale on the coast path to Lamorna. Very raw wind but warming up in car.
Boxing day welly throwing taking place in car park at Treen L:50.0497,-5.6407:
Lounging in front of TV, drinking Coke and eating Cheese Footballs and sweets.
Finished lunch. Lovely free-range Devon turkey bird and vintage Champagne.
Merry Christmas, Twitter / Facebook / MSN
Omg, after 4 pints, went to Midnight Mass, got handed a cassock and told I was the only male in the choir. I don't even go to this church!
Pubbage, then Midnight Mass.
Did Christmas shopping too early. I wrapped Dad's present and hid it in my room last month. Now I have no idea where it is.
Lovely 'Christmas present' received this morning. 750g of bureau QSL cards to answer, less than 2 months after the last load. #HAMR
Feeling strangely un-Christmassy. I think it's because the weather has got mild.
